contentrichtext.text: [[Image:Jämsänkoski.vaakuna.png|thumb|right|Coat of arms of Jämsänkoski]] '''Jämsänkoski''' is a former [[List of cities and towns in Finland|town]] and [[List of former municipalities of Finland|municipality]] in central [[Finland]] located near [[Lake Päijänne]] and the [[Jämsänjoki]] river. The town had population of 7,351 (2008).<ref name="population_count_2008">{{Cite web |url= http://vrk.fi/default.aspx?docid=786&site=3&id=0 |title= Population by municipality as of {{#time: j F Y|2008-12-31}} |accessdate={{#time: j F Y|2010-11-23}} |work= Population Information System |publisher= Population Register Center of Finland |language= Finnish and Swedish}}</ref> It covered an area of 448.67 km² of which 48.02 km² is water. The [[population density]] was 16.9 inhabitants per km². The [[paper mill]] owned by [[UPM Kymmene]] is the largest employer of Jämsä. [[Image:Koskenpaa vaakuna.jpg|thumb|left|75px|Coat of arms of Koskenpää]] Jämsänkoski was founded in 1926 when it separated from the bigger [[municipalities of Finland|municipality]] of [[Jämsä]]. Municipality of [[Koskenpää]] was consolidated with Jämsänkoski in the beginning of 1969. Jämsänkoski was a township since 1986. It belongs to the administrative [[district]] of [[Western Finland]] although [[Central Finland]] remains the centre for [[labour (economics)|labour]] and [[trade]]. Jämsänkoski was consolidated with [[Jämsä]] in 2009. ==Twinnings== *{{flagicon|Estonia}} [[Luunja Parish]], Estonia ==References== <references/> ==External links== {{commonscat-inline|Jämsänkoski}} *[http://www.jamsankoski.fi Official site] {{CentralFinland}} {{coord|61|55|05|N|25|10|15|E|region:FI_type:city(7581)_scale:50000|display=title}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Jamsankoski}} [[Category:Populated places established in 1926]] [[Category:Populated places disestablished in 2009]] [[Category:Former municipalities of Finland]] [[Category:Jämsä]] {{WesternFinland-geo-stub}}
